{"step_by_step_thinking": "The submandibular gland is a salivary gland located beneath the lower jaw. The blood supply to this gland comes from the facial artery, which is a branch of the external carotid artery (ECA). The other options, ascending pharyngeal, superior pharyngeal, and maxillary, are also branches of the ECA, but they do not supply the submandibular gland.", "answer_choice": "D. Facial"}
